NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_NUTS: East Ayrshire and North Ayrshire mainland

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: Услуги по поддържане на други зелени площи

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Corporate Procurement Team, London Road HQ

CONTACT_DATA.ADDRESS: Corporate Procurement Team, London Road HQ

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Rural grass cutting & weed control service.

LOCATION.P: Various locations throughout East Ayrshire Council.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: The Council is looking to contract with a service provider for the maintenance of roadside grounds, including rural grass cutting (full road network), rural weed control, occassional gully cleaning (A71 dual carriageway only) scrub clearance, minor tree surgery, urban weed control & associated traffic management.

Note: to register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland web site at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=197030.

The Awarding Authority has indicated that it will accept electronic responses to this notice via a "tender submission postbox" facility. Further details of this facility are available at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/PostBox/Postbox_Explain.aspx?ID=197030.

Suppliers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems. The postbox closes precisely at the time stated.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The annual value is anticipated to be in the region of 100 000 and 130 000 GBP, although the actual requirements are variable and subject to change.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The contract is for a period of 2 years with 2 additional 1-year extension options at the sole discretion of the Council.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Monthly in arrears, within 28 days of receipt of valid invoice.

LEGAL_FORM.P: No specific legal form required. However, the Council will only contract with a single legal entity (the lead bidder) with all other partnering organisations (to the lead bidder) being regarded as sub-contractors.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: (1) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that they are not bankrupt or the subject of an administration order, are not being wound-up, have not granted a trust deed, are not the subject of a petition presented for sequestration of their estate, have not had a receiver, manager or administrator appointed and are not otherwise apparently insolvent;

(2) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that the candidate, their directors, or any other person who has powers of representation, decision or control of the candidate has not been convicted of conspiracy, corruption, bribery, or money laundering. Failure to provide such a declaration will result in the candidate being declared ineligible and they will not be selected to participate in this procurement process;

(3) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that they have not been convicted of a criminal offence relating to the conduct of their business or profession;
(4) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that they have not committed an act of grave misconduct in the course of their business or profession;
(5) Any candidate found to be guilty of serious misrepresentation in providing any information required, may be declared ineligible and not selected to continue with this procurement process;

(6) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that they have fulfilled obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions under the law of any part of the United Kingdom or of the relevant state in which the candidate is established;

(7) All candidates will be required to produce a certificate or declaration demonstrating that they have fulfilled obligations relating to the payment of taxes under the law of any part of the United Kingdom or of the relevant state in which the economic operator is established.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Contractor's financial standing will be appraised using a third party Financial Credit Agency report.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: (1) A list of works carried out over the past 5 years, detailing the value of the consideration received; when and where the work or works were carried out; and whether they were carried out according to the rules of the trade or profession and properly completed.
Similar projects to be listed in the PQQ.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: Financial standing, technical competence/ability, health & safety and equal opportunities compliance. A report will be sought from a third-party credit agency that will score the financial standing element of the scoring matrix. The top-ranked companies of between 5-10 will be invited to tender.

RECURRENT_PROCUREMENT.P: 2, 3 or 4 years hence depending upon optional extensions.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Interested parties may download electronic versions of the PQQ and associated documents from www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk, no paper copies or emailed versions will be made available.
Please visit this site, register your interest, download the PQQ documents and upload the completed PQQ to the same site by not later than 12 noon on 21.2.2011.
The rates will be fixed for the first year of the contract with annual adjustments calculated using the GM87 Price Index.
The conditions of contract will be ICE conditions of contract minor works. The specification and measurement will be the manual of contract documents for highway works volume 1 and 4.

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: An economic operator that suffers, or risks suffering, loss or damage attributable to a breach of duty under the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2006 (SSI 2006/1) (as amended) may bring proceedings in the Sherriff Court or the Court of Session.
